name: Gender, Politics and Society
description: This course analyzes the social structural forces that produce gender and the ways in which gender affects political and social change. Possible topics include: migration, social movements, social policy and the welfare state, and globalization. We will also pay special attention to the ways in which gender intersects with class, ethnicity, race, religion and other forces of difference. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/231H5, 221H5, 0.5 SOC credit at the 200 level
